decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using Smallpox and Orcish Bowmasters to control the board. It aims to generate value and card advantage through recurring lands with Life from the Loam and using Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts. Grist, the Hunger Tide and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis provide threats that can quickly end the game. The deck also has graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb and versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Witherbloom Command. Overall, it is a control deck that leverages the graveyard and land destruction to control the game.

The main focus of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats such as Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also aims to control the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and Surgical Extraction. Misty Rainforest, Polluted Delta, and fetch lands help to thin the deck and find the necessary mana while cards like Brazen Borrower and Lightning Bolt provide additional removal and flexibility in dealing with threats.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up and play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to overwhelm the opponent. The deck relies on mana acceleration through cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to get ahead on board presence and disrupt the opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void. By using cards like Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin, the deck can quickly bring out its threats and apply pressure to the opponent, aiming to win the game through fast and aggressive plays.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Mystic Forge combo by generating mana with artifacts like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal, while controlling the board with cards like Pithing Needle and Kozilek's Command. The key cards are Mystic Forge, Urza's Saga, and Karn, the Great Creator, which allow the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn and generate a powerful board state. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of card advantage, mana acceleration, and powerful threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Walking Ballista.

The deck revolves around the combo of using Cephalid Illusionist with Nomads en-Kor to mill your library and put Narcomoeba and other key cards into play, ultimately winning the game with either Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. It includes protection with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with card draw and manipulation tools like Brainstorm and Ponder. The land base supports the combo with cards like Urza's Saga and Cavern of Souls. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of disruptive spells and powerful creatures. The goal is to control the board with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard. Additionally, utilizing Aether Vial allows for instant speed creature deployment and the ability to generate card advantage with Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for added value. This deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a mix of disruption and aggression.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on disrupting opponents' mana bases while quickly deploying powerful threats. By utilizing cards such as Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to lock down opponents and limit their options. The aggressive nature of the deck is highlighted by cards like Sundering Eruption and Fury, which can quickly close out games with their high damage output. Additionally, the use of fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide allows for explosive starts and early pressure on opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements and defensive strategies to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It includes cards that search for specific key cards, counter spells to stop the opponent's threats, and enchantments like Rest in Peace and Energy Field to shut down graveyard strategies. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Helm of Obedience and Court of Cunning. The main goal is to establish a strong board presence while controlling the game tempo and eventually winning through attrition or locking out the opponent.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board by efficiently dealing with threats while setting up card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Nihil Spellbomb allows the deck to handle a wide range of threats, while threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Thundertrap Trainer provide win conditions. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy and maximize consistency.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher early in the game by utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb. It also disrupts opponents' strategies by using cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland to control the board. With a combination of fast mana sources and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on using artifacts as a resource engine to quickly build a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Urza's Bauble to generate mana and draw cards, the deck is able to play aggressively and efficiently. Memory Guardian, Patchwork Automaton, and Pinnacle Emissary provide threats that can quickly overwhelm the opponent, while Emry, Lurker of the Loch acts as a recurring value engine. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Metallic Rebuke to control the opponent's resources and protect its own game plan.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to disrupt opponents' strategies with a variety of counterspells and removal spells, while also generating card advantage through card draw and manipulation effects like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck aims to control the game and outvalue opponents with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Quantum Riddler. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize its efficiency. Overall, this deck prioritizes control and resource management to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures through cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a powerful early-game advantage. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and control the opponent's actions. By efficiently combining graveyard manipulation with powerful threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory before they have a chance to respond.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost along with Glimmerpost and Ancient Tomb to be able to play powerful cards like Karn, the Great Creator and The One Ring. Chalice of the Void helps control the opponent's spells, while Stock Up and Lrien Revealed provide card advantage. Planar Nexus can be used to reset the game if needed, and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provides additional removal options. Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect the combo pieces, making it difficult for the opponent to disrupt the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly casting aggressive creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Dragon's Rage Channeler to deal damage to the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to control the game and protect its threats. The deck utilizes card selection and card advantage with spells like Preordain and Brainstorm to ensure consistent draws. Additionally, it includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to deal with opposing threats. The mana base consists of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana production for the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill the library, getting Narcomoeba into play and Dread Return Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck includes a mix of control elements like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the combo, alongside card selection and search tools like Brainstorm and Ponder. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional utility by allowing the deck to search for key artifacts like Shuko. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can disrupt it.
